intro: Nama stevensii, commonly known as the red sandras, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and clusters of small, vibrant flowers that range in color from yellow to red. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in sandy soils. Nama stevensii is well adapted to drought conditions, making it a resilient species in harsh climates.
